Class Researcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • Researcher

  • public class Researcher
extends java.lang.Object

    Researcher Class

    This is the Researcher class. The researcher is the main character of the game. She has a x position, y position, direction, number of lives, and a rectangle. The research character is actually painted statically on the panel (with walking animation) but the larger frame moves in opposite of the incrementing xPos and yPos to simulate movement. The player's rectangle is used for collision detection using java's rectangle collision.

    Note: Anytime in the method describitions for this class, if it says 'the Researcher moves' it means that the character is still painted statically, but the characters x and y increase and decrease during the game, moving the background, until the end of the game, where the background becomes static and the player actually move across the screen, signaling the end of the game

    • Constructor Detail

      • Researcher

        public Researcher(int x,
                  int y,
                  RDirection direction,
                  int lives)

        Researcher Contructor

        The Researcher contructor is set by a x and y position, a direction, and the lives. There is also a rectangle that is associated with the the characters feet, used for collision of crabs and out of bounds
        Parameters:
        x - the current x location of the Researcher incremented by the controller, does not actually move the character Researcher but moves the background inverted to simulate movement
        y - the current y location of the Researcher incremented by the controller, does not actually move the character Researcher but moves the background inverted to simulate movement
        direction - the direction of the Researcher using the RDirection Enum set, East, NorthEast, SouthEast, and Idle
        lives - remaining lives of the Researcher, the player will lose a life if they step on a crab because they are heartbroken over it. Going off the platforms results in lose of all 3 lives, where the game restarts

    • Method Detail

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(RDirection direction)

        SetDirection

        Sets the direction of the Researcher, used in the Controller to set which direction the player wants the character to be moving in.
        Parameters:
        direction - this is the new direction that is set for the Researcher. RDirection is an Enum type

      • getDirection

        public RDirection getDirection()

        getDirection

        Returns the current direction that is set to the Researcher, used in View to get the current direction to set the correct animation.
        Returns:
        Researcher's current direction, one of the RDirection Enums East, NorthEast, SouthEast, and Idle

      • setLives

        public void setLives(int lives)

        setLives

        Sets the number of lives the Research has, base lives is 3, used heavily in the collision methods in Model to subtract a life for stepping on a crab, or all 3 for going of the platforms
        Parameters:
        lives - new number of lives the Researcher will have

      • getLives

        public int getLives()

        getLives

        Returns the current number of lives the Researcher has left, used in Model to see whether the game should be restarted if it drops to 0 or not
        Returns:
        Researcher's current number of lives

      • getxPos

        public int getxPos()

        getxPos

        Returns the Researcher's current x position, used heavily in the Model and View for the player position
        Returns:
        Researcher's current x position

      • setxPos

        public void setxPos(int xPos)

        setxPos

        Sets the Researcher's x position to a new value xPos, used in Model to increment to players x position given a constant walk speed increase
        Parameters:
        xPos - the new value that the Researcher will have for its x position

      • getyPos

        public int getyPos()

        getyPos

        Returns the Researcher's current y position, used heavily in the Model and View for the player position
        Returns:
        Researcher's current y position

      • setyPos

        public void setyPos(int yPos)

        setyPos

        Sets the Researcher's y position to a new value yPos, used in Model to increment to players y position given a constant walk speed increase
        Parameters:
        yPos - the new value that the Researcher will have for its y position

      • getPlayerRect

        public java.awt.Rectangle getPlayerRect()

        getPlayerRect

        Returns the Researcher's Rectangle, set at the player feet and used in Model for colision detection. The rectangle is not showed to the player but can be seen for testing. Moves along with the Researcher's x and y
        Returns:
        The Researcher's current rectangle
